source.content: <doc> <child1>child number 1</child1> <child2>child number 2</child2> <child3>Selection of this child is an error.</child3> </doc>
<doc> <child1>Text for variable</child1> <child2>Text for location Path</child2> <child3>Selection of this child is an error.</child3> </doc>
<!-- First comment --> <doc> <!-- Front comment --> <inner/> <!-- Back comment --> </doc> <!-- Last comment -->
in-a in-c
in-a in-c

test-case.name: select-0101
test-case.description: Test for absolute path selection.

test-case.name: select-0102
test-case.description: Test for select that comes up empty.

test-case.name: select-0201
test-case.description: Test of current() function - just select it.

test-case.name: select-0202
test-case.description: Show that current() produces a node-set.

test-case.name: select-0301
test-case.description: Test for select in for-each and current().

test-case.name: select-0401
test-case.description: Purpose: Test of unions, returned in document order.

test-case.name: select-0501
test-case.description: Test for selecting parent nodes.

test-case.name: select-0601
test-case.description: Test nesting of for-each.

test-case.name: select-0701
test-case.description: Try to put out computed text without any tags.

test-case.name: select-0801
test-case.description: Purpose: Test assignment of a node-set to a parameter, then use in select.

result.assert-xml:
<out>Got a foo node;Got some other node;
Got some other node;
Got a wiz node;Got a foo node;</out>

test-case.name: select-0802
test-case.description: Test assignment of a node-set to a local parameter, then use in select.

result.assert-xml:
<out>Got a foo node;Got some other node;
Got some other node;
Got a wiz node;Got a foo node;</out>

test-case.name: select-0901
test-case.description: Test for-each with select expression in a global variable.

test-case.name: select-0902
test-case.description: Test for-each with select expression in a local variable.

test-case.name: select-1001
test-case.description: Test that for-each doesn't care about current node Collect a node-set, outside any template

test-case.name: select-1101
test-case.description: Purpose: Node-set union using mixed axes

result.assert-xml: <out>preceding sibling number 1 following sibling number 3 cousin 3 </out>

test-case.name: select-1201
test-case.description: NCName followed by :: must be recognized as an AxisName.

test-case.name: select-1202
test-case.description: NCName followed by :: must be recognized as an AxisName, even if there is intervening whitespace.

test-case.name: select-1301
test-case.description: NCName followed by ( must be recognized as a NodeType or FunctionName.

test-case.name: select-1302
test-case.description: NCName followed by ( must be recognized as a NodeType or FunctionName, even if there is intervening whitespace.

test-case.name: select-1401
test-case.description: NCName followed by ( must be recognized as a NodeType or FunctionName.

test-case.name: select-1402
test-case.description: NCName followed by ( must be recognized as a NodeType or FunctionName, even if there is intervening whitespace.

test-case.name: select-1501
test-case.description: Test of select in xsl:apply-templates with document-node() and predicate

test-case.name: select-1502
test-case.description: Test of select in xsl:apply-templates with attribute()

test-case.name: select-1503
test-case.description: Test of select in xsl:apply-templates with element()

test-case.name: select-1504
test-case.description: Test of select in xsl:apply-templates with element() and predicate index

test-case.name: select-1601
test-case.description: Test of select in xsl:apply-templates with *:NCName

test-case.name: select-1602
test-case.description: Test of select in xsl:apply-templates with *:NCName, NCName:* and predicate index

test-case.name: select-1701
test-case.description: Test of select in xsl:apply-templates with complex pathExpr involving various node and name tests

test-case.name: select-1702
test-case.description: Test of select in xsl:apply-templates with variable reference and predicate

test-case.name: select-1703
test-case.description: Test of select in xsl:apply-templates with function call

test-case.name: select-1704
test-case.description: Test of select in xsl:apply-templates with forExpr

result.assert-xml: <out><t1>num1 | num2 | num3 | num4 | num6 | num5 | </t1><t2>num1 | num2 | num4 | </t2></out>

test-case.name: select-1705
test-case.description: Test of select in xsl:value-of with complex pathExpr involving various node and name tests

test-case.description: Test of select in xsl:apply-templates with QualifiedExpr

test-case.description: Test of select in xsl:apply-templates with ifExpr with predicate index

test-case.description: Test of select in xsl:apply-templates with CastableExpr

test-case.description: Test of select in xsl:apply-templates with intersectExceptExpr

test-case.description: Test of select in xsl:apply-templates with current function

test-case.description: Test of select in xsl:value-of with document-node()

test-case.description: Test of select in xsl:value-of with document-node() and predicate index

test-case.description: Test of select in xsl:value-of with ForExpr

test-case.description: Test of select in xsl:value-of with ifExpr

test-case.description: Test of select in xsl:value-of with nodeComp operator

test-case.description: Test of select in xsl:value-of with instanceOf and cast operator

test-case.description: Test of select in xsl:value-of with set operations: except and intersect

test-case.description: Test of select in xsl:value-of with current function

test-case.description: Test of select in xsl:value-of with empty sequence

test-case.description: Test of select in xsl:for-each with document-node()

test-case.description: Test of select in xsl:for-each with document-node() and predicate index

test-case.description: Test of select in xsl:for-each with attribute() and predicate index

test-case.description: Test of select in xsl:for-each with element()

test-case.description: Test of select in xsl:for-each with element() and predicate index

test-case.description: Test of select in xsl:for-each with complex pathExpr involving various node and name tests

test-case.description: Test of select in xsl:for-each with sequence of atomic values and predicate

test-case.description: Test of select in xsl:for-each with sequence of node and atomic values and predicate

test-case.description: Test of select in xsl:for-each with function call: fn:reverse

test-case.description: Test of select in xsl:for-each with rangeExpr

test-case.description: Test of select in xsl:for-each with ForExpr

test-case.description: Test of select in xsl:for-each with QualifiedExpr

test-case.description: Test of select in xsl:for-each with ifExpr

test-case.description: Test of select in xsl:for-each with nodeComp operator

test-case.description: Test of select in xsl:for-each with valueComp operator

test-case.description: Test of select in xsl:for-each with generalComp operator

test-case.description: Test of select in xsl:for-each with instanceOf and cast operator

test-case.description: Test of select in xsl:for-each with set operations

test-case.description: Test of select in xsl:for-each with current function

test-case.description: Test of select in xsl:for-each with empty sequence

test-case.name: select-2101
test-case.description: Test of select in xsl:value-of with *:NCName and NCName:*

test-case.name: select-2102
test-case.description: Test of select in xsl:value-of with *:NCName, NCName:* and predicate index

test-case.name: select-2103
test-case.description: Test of select in xsl:for-each with *:NCName and NCName:*

test-case.name: select-2104
test-case.description: Test of select in xsl:for-each with *:NCName , NCName:* and predicate index

test-case.name: select-2201
test-case.description: Test of select in xsl:apply-templates with processing-instruction(NCName)

test-case.name: select-2202
test-case.description: Test of select in xsl:apply-templates with processing-instruction(NCName) with predicate

test-case.name: select-2203
test-case.description: Test of select in xsl:for-each with processing-instruction(NCName)

test-case.name: select-2301
test-case.description: Test of select in xsl:value-of for simple content construction

test-case.name: select-2302
test-case.description: Test of select in xsl:for-each when context item is atomic type

test-case.name: select-2303
test-case.description: Test case to verify that in an xsl:value-of instruction zero-length text nodes in the sequence are discarded.

test-case.name: select-2304
test-case.description: Test case to verify that in an xsl:value-of instruction adjacent text nodes in the sequence are merged into a single text node.

test-case.name: select-2305
test-case.description: Test case to verify that the strings within the resulting sequence are concatenated, with a (zero-length) separator inserted between successive strings.

test-case.name: select-2401
test-case.description: Test case to verify that the sequence in an xsl:value-of instruction is atomized.

result.assert-xml: Absolute disaster in the world Absolute disaster in the world Absolutedisasterintheworld

test-case.name: select-2402
test-case.description: Test case to verify that the sequence in an xsl:value-of instruction is atomized.

test-case.name: select-2501
test-case.description: NCName as first item must not be treated as an operator

test-case.name: select-2502
test-case.description: * as first item must not be treated as an operator

test-case.name: select-2503
test-case.description: * after ( must not be treated as operator, but * after ) is, and being tokenized means following * is not (because it follows an operator)

test-case.name: select-2504
test-case.description: NCName after operator must not be treated as operator

test-case.name: select-2505
test-case.description: * after (ambiguous) operator must not be treated as operator

test-case.name: select-2506
test-case.description: * after (named) operator must not be treated as operator

test-case.name: select-2601
test-case.description: NCName after @ must not be treated as an operator

test-case.name: select-2602
test-case.description: NCName after @ must not be treated as an operator; space after is questionable.

test-case.name: select-2603
test-case.description: NCName after @ must not be treated as an operator; lack of spaces around hyphen makes it part of name.

test-case.name: select-2701
test-case.description: * after @ must be treated as all attributes

test-case.name: select-2801
test-case.description: NCName after :: must be treated as part of path

test-case.name: select-2802
test-case.description: NCName after :: must be treated as part of path

test-case.name: select-2901
test-case.description: NCName after ( must not be treated as operator

test-case.name: select-3001
test-case.description: NCName after [ must not be treated as operator

test-case.name: select-3101
test-case.description: * after [ must not be treated as operator

test-case.name: select-3201
test-case.description: name after ) must be treated as operator

test-case.name: select-3301
test-case.description: name after literal should be treated as operator

test-case.name: select-3401
test-case.description: name after * should not be treated as operator

test-case.name: select-3501
test-case.description: . after operator should be treated as path

test-case.name: select-3502
test-case.description: * after operator should be treated as path

test-case.name: select-3601
test-case.description: Purpose: NodeSet union using two absolute location paths

test-case.name: select-3602
test-case.description: Purpose: NodeSet union using absolute and relative location paths Expression002 in NIST suite

test-case.name: select-3603
test-case.description: Purpose: NodeSet union using two relative location paths Expression020 in NIST suite

test-case.name: select-3701
test-case.description: Purpose: NodeSet union using the ancestor axis Expression003 in NIST suite

test-case.name: select-3801
test-case.description: Purpose: NodeSet union using the ancestor-or-self axis Heavily modified from Expression004 in NIST suite 8 different ones

test-case.name: select-3901
test-case.description: Purpose: test union operator using two paths with predicates. Expression005 in NIST suite

test-case.name: select-3902
test-case.description: Purpose: test union operator on two paths, each with complex predicate. Expression008 in NIST suite

test-case.name: select-4001
test-case.description: Purpose: NodeSet union using the child axis Expression007 in NIST suite

test-case.name: select-4101
test-case.description: Purpose: NodeSet union using the descendant axis Expression009 in NIST suite

test-case.name: select-4102
test-case.description: Purpose: NodeSet union using the descendant-or-self axis Expression010 in NIST suite

test-case.name: select-4201
test-case.description: Purpose: test union operator using predicates testing element and attribute nodes. Expression011 in NIST suite

test-case.name: select-4301
test-case.description: Purpose: test union operator where union yields empty set. Expression012 in NIST suite

test-case.name: select-4302
test-case.description: Purpose: test union operator using variables. Expression013 in NIST suite

test-case.name: select-4401
test-case.description: Purpose: NodeSet union using the following-sibling and preceding-sibling axes Expression013 in NIST suite

result.assert-xml: <out> preceding sibling number 1 following sibling number 3 </out>

test-case.name: select-4501
test-case.description: Purpose: NodeSet union using a function that returns a node set (key) and an axis. Expression014 in NIST suite

result.assert-xml: <out> book1 book3 book5 book9 book11 book13 book15 article 1 </out>

test-case.name: select-4601
test-case.description: Purpose: NodeSet union using a function that returns a node set (key) as each term. Expression015 in NIST suite

result.assert-xml: <out> book2 book4 book6 book8 book10 book12 </out>

test-case.name: select-4701
test-case.description: Purpose: test union operator at different nesting levels (same element) Expression016 in NIST suite

result.assert-xml: <out> Carmelo Montanez David Marston Mary Brady Lynne Rosenthal </out>

test-case.name: select-4801
test-case.description: Purpose: test union operator at different nesting levels (different elements) Expression017 in NIST suite

result.assert-xml: <out> Carmelo Montanez David Marston Mary Brady Five </out>

test-case.name: select-4901
test-case.description: Purpose: test union operator where one of the members is empty Expression018 in NIST suite

test-case.name: select-5001
test-case.description: Purpose: test union operator using overlapping node-sets. Results should always be output in doc order regardless of order of select attribute. (original)

result.assert-xml: <out> EFGJKNOP, EFGJKNOP, EFGJKNOP, EFGJKNOP, EFGJKNOP, EFGJKNOP, </out>

test-case.name: select-5101
test-case.description: Purpose: NodeSet union using the self axis Expression021 in NIST suite

result.assert-xml: <out> self content number 1 self content number 2 </out>

test-case.name: select-5201
test-case.description: Purpose: union of two absolute (//) paths Expression022 in NIST suite

test-case.name: select-5301
test-case.description: Purpose: test union operator used three times in an expression Expression023 in NIST suite

test-case.name: select-5401
test-case.description: Purpose: test union operator using a variable and a function. Expression024 in NIST suite

test-case.name: select-5501
test-case.description: Purpose: test union operator using a variable and an axis. Expression025 in NIST suite

result.assert-xml: <out> Text for variable Text for location Path </out>

test-case.name: select-5601
test-case.description: Test that document('') refers to this stylesheet, and exploit that fact to choose a template dynamically. Idea from Mike Kay.

result.assert-xml: <out>We are inside. xsl:template We are generic. inside </out>

test-case.name: select-5701
test-case.description: Test that document('') refers to this stylesheet, and exploit that fact to have data file select which template to use. Priorities added by MHK to suppress warnings.

test-case.name: select-5801
test-case.description: Test whether null string as attribute value causes selection problem.

test-case.name: select-5901
test-case.description: Purpose: Test union operator using overlapping node-sets. Results should always be output in doc order regardless of order of select attribute.

test-case.name: select-6001
test-case.description: Purpose: NodeSet union using two copies of same node, and variables This could be used to establish that the variable is of the node-set type, as opposed to string or one-node RTF, where the count would go up.

result.assert-xml: <out> Count of node-set: 1 Count of union: 1</out>

test-case.name: select-6101
test-case.description: Test that entity does not cause splitting of one text node into many. With this output encoding, should get one byte of xE9 for the &eacute

modified.change: The test tests the serialization of entities, changed it to use the new assert-serialization (and fixed line-ends, hope Hg treats them well)

test-case.name: select-6201
test-case.description: Section: 8 Repetition Purpose: Test for-each example from XSLT spec.

test-case.name: select-6301
test-case.description: Ensure that select='/' gets what it should.

result.assert-xml: <out> Comment found: Front comment Comment found: Back comment ...Back to top... Comment found: First comment Comment found: Last comment </out>

test-case.name: select-6401
test-case.description: Try /{name} to match the document element.

test-case.name: select-6501
test-case.description: Try to select a non-existent attribute out of a node-set variable

test-case.name: select-6601
test-case.description: Simple test of current() in for-each.

test-case.name: select-6701
test-case.description: Simple test of current() in apply-templates. the doc node stringification of doc node

result.assert-xml: <out> <content from="x" size="1">alpha omega</content> <content from="y" size="1">alpha omega</content></out>

test-case.name: select-6801
test-case.description: Try a positional predicate on descendants of a node-set variable Collect a node-set, outside any template

result.assert-xml: <out>Found the tag... item3,subsubitem-early,subitem1, Found the tag... item3,subsubitem-early,subitem1, </out>

test-case.name: select-6901
test-case.description: Try absolute path when current node is in middle of tree

result.assert-xml: <out><rel> Hello There World </rel><abs> Hello There World </abs></out>

test-case.name: select-7001
test-case.description: Test //* to get all elements

test-case.name: select-7101
test-case.description: Test //@x to get all attributes of a certain name

result.assert-xml: <out><list> Node doc has on-doc in @x Node a has on-a in @x Node b has on-b in @x Node bbb has on-bbb in @x Node c has on-c in @x</list></out>

test-case.name: select-7201
test-case.description: Test //@* to get all attributes in the tree

test-case.name: select-7301
test-case.description: Test current() by itself in a predicate. Both of the following should select the same thing.

test-case.name: select-7401
test-case.description: Purpose: Test that current() returns a node-set suitable for count(). Elaboration: There was a bug, masked by current()/sub-node

test-case.name: select-7501
test-case.description: Tests xsl:for-each with missing the REQURED select attribute.

test-case.name: select-7502a
test-case.description: Test omission of the both the select and sequence constructor in xsl:value-of instruction

test-case.name: select-7502b
test-case.description: Test omission of the both the select and sequence constructor in xsl:value-of instruction
